titles.title: Save Our Children Act of 1999
To direct the United States Sentencing Commission to provide penalty enhancements for drug offenses committed in the presence of children.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime.

bill.summary: 2/2/1999--Introduced. Save Our Children Act of 1999 - Directs the U.S. Sentencing Commission to amend or promulgate sentencing guidelines to provide that certain drug offenses committed in the presence of a child receive a penalty enhancement of the greater of: (1) two offense levels or one year, for the first such offense; or (2) four offense levels or two years, for the second such offense.
